page.title: 0112 SQ.KM around Thornhill.
page.content: The area we are writing about is the 3km.stretch around Thornhill which stretches 4km.West.It is mostly a country area with several dairy and hill farms.There are also a few woods ,lochs and rivers.In Thornhill there is a road called Station Road.It is called that because the station is at the end of it.The station is not in use any more because not many people stopped in Thornhill.Next to the station is Thornhill market which is still in use today.If we move further North we come to Morton Old Church which is now a ruin and has very old gravestones about it,one of which is said to be a pirate's.If we move South East we come to Gatelawbridge which is a tiny little hamlet.There are several quarries around Gatelawbridge.To the East of the village lie the Morton Hills.
